intro: Galium gaudichaudii subsp. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Native to certain regions of the southeastern United States, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
